effect: Ignore all _Cover_ unless a creature is fully underneath obstacles.
Attacks with the Artillery Keyword have Disadvantage on all attacks against creature X spaces or less away, where X is their Artillery value.
Attacks with this tag don't have Disadvantage when attacking Armor.
Accurate Attacks innately have Advantage.
The Cost of Evade Reactions is reduced by 1 against this Action.
Block Reactions are based on absorbing a blow to mitigate the overall damage. Many Actions and abilities reference Block Reactions. Block Reactions have their Cost increased by 1 on a Crit.
Weapons with the Body Keyword can be used regardless of what a character has Wielded.
Movement with the Charge keyword can move through squares occupied by hostile creatures, but may not end their movement their.
A side of a space may be climable if it has obvious handholds or avenues to climb that make traversal easier. Climbing in a climable space only costs 1 + the vertical distance covered.

A Combo Technique allows characters to easily change their attack style between Attacks in a Technique. A character may pay 1 Momentum before making an Attack; if they do, they may apply a different set of Enhancements to a single Attack. They may use the original Tokens utilized for Enhancements on this Technique and freely purchase new Enhancements without paying any Improvise Cost. For example, if a character spent 3 Momentum on Enhancements for this Technique originally, they may use up to 3 Momentum of Enhancements for an Attack without spending any resources beyond the initial 1 Momentum. Individual Enhancements may be applied to multiple Attacks in the same Combo, but must obey all other restrictions. Future Attacks in the Combo may use either set of Enhancements, chosen for each Attack.
Take the creature's total Value of a Token and divide it into the minimum number of Tokens. For example, a creature with Impaired 1x3 would have Impaired 3 after this Technique.

Earthen Terrain or Obstacles are prominent above-ground features created primarily from earth or stone. Boulders and Earth Pillars are obvious examples, but any stone structure can qualify as Earthen.
Reactions with the Efficient Keyword do not use your Reaction for the Turn.

Actions with the Electric Keyword excel at hitting conductive targets. Electric Attacks have Advantage against any Creature that has a Metal Source or is Soaked. In addition, Electric Techniques that target a creature in a Water Source may ignore their typical area. If the Technique was previously Single Target, halve the damage but it instead becomes a Blast 1 if Range or Burst 1 if melee. If the Technique had an Area, increase the size of the Area by 1. Regardless, the Technique has Advantage.
Enchant effects are an effect that persists for multiple Turns or Rounds. A creature may only have one Enchant ability in effect at a time.
This Enhancement must be Attached to the Use Environment Technique. Only a single Enhancement with this Tag may be Attached at a time.
Evade Reactions typically involve avoiding a blow or quickly moving to avoid further damage. Many Actions and abilities reference Evade Reactions.
Tokens with the Fleeting Keyword are lost at the end of the current Turn.
Techniques with the Flourish Keyword can Improvise any other Technique with the Flourish Keyword at no Cost.
Reduce the Cost to Improvise this Action or an Action using this Weapon by its Fluid Value. This only reduces the Cost to Improvise, not the overall Cost of the Action or Enhancement.
Weapons with the Fist Keyword require an Open Hand to use.
This Effect deals half Damage and has its cost to Negate reduced by 1. If an Attack already has Glancing and gains it from another source, the Attack is made at Disadvantage.

Groundsource effects ignore Cover, do not gain Disadvantage from Prone if they are Ranged, and Area Effects are not stopped by Terrain like normal. Flying creatures are immune to all Groundsource effects. Groundsource effects must be used on terrain made of earth or stone or are in close proximity to such. The wooden floor of a house on solid ground, for example, would be fine, but the deck of a ship would not.
Hazards reflect an area that is going to be attacked in the near future or can be triggered as a trap. All Hazards are always cleared at the end of a Round.
Heavy attacks are powerful and deal additional damage with a Strong Enhancements but cannot be used with Quick Enhancements.

Weapons with the Kick Keyword can be used regardless of what a character has Wielded but have Disadvantage if a character is Stuck and take a Penalty to Attack Rolls equal to the character's topmost Hobbled Token.
Light attacks swift and are more effective on Quick Enhancements but cannot be used with Strong Enhancements.
Any Leaping Movement ignores Terrain that does not effect Flying characters. Characters may also go up Elevation while Leaping so long as they have sufficient Leaping Movement.
Whenever you learn a Technique with the Martial Keyword you may select an Unarmed Weapon with the Martial Keyword. You always count as having this Weapon Wielded.
Any Attack with this Weapon must be made before any Movement is made as a part of this Action.
This Attack ignores an amount of the Target's Guard equal to its Pierce value. Attacks with the Pierce tag deal additional Damage to Armor and Equipment equaL to its Pierce value.
This Enhancement may not be used with Heavy Techniques.
A Reaction that typically triggers off of a different creature's movement.
A Priority Action is always resolved at the start of its Phase. It ignores normal turn order and does not count for the alternating turns within a Round.
Attacks with the Reach keyword are treated as Melee for the purposes of all effects, but can be used at a range equal to their Reach value.
All Reactions with the Opportunity tag cost an additional X, where X is this Technique's Safe value.
When you Scout a creature you learn either their current exact Health and how much Focus, Grit, Reflex, or Momentum (your choice) the creature has.
Attacks with the Siege tag deal +2 Damage to Obstacles and have Advantage on Attacks against them.
A Small Weapon does not take up as much space as a traditional one. When determining the weapons you are carrying, you can carry the Small value for this weapon in a single Weapons Slot.

Spirit Techniques are the innate magic of a spiritbound, making use of both parties for powerful effects. Spirit Techniques do not require an Open Hand, but if a creature cannot use either Hand the Cost of a Spirit Action is increased by 1 Momentum.
Attacks with this tag don't have Disadvantage when attacking Weapons.
This Enhancement may not be used with Light Techniques.
The Cost of Evade Reactions is increased by its Sure Hit value against this Technique.
A Stall Action is always resolved at the end of its Phase. It ignores normal turn order and does not count for the alternating turns within a Round.
This Enchancement may be used multiple times in a Round and may be applied to the same Technique multiple times, paying the cost each time.
When a creature is inflicted with Reveal their next Technique and what Phase it is occurring in is revealed. If a creature has no more Techniques this round, they instead have Knowledge 1 inflicted.
This Technique may not be Improvised.
When taking your Movement with a Technique that has the Rush Keyword you must move in a straight line.

A side of a space may be designated as stairs if it has an obvious path up, such as literal stairs. It costs no additional movement to move up 1 Elevation when moving through a stairs segment of a space.
Teleport Movement ignores Terrain, Obstacles, and cannot provoke Reactions.

Thrown weapons are capable of being used in both melee and ranged combat. When Thrown, Grazes deal no damage and cause no effects, and are treated as a _Miss_ for all effects. After being thrown, a Thrown weapon may not be used again until retrieved. Unlike most Weapons, you may use a Thrown Weapon to attack if it is Equipped, but must have a Free Hand to do so.
The Cost of Block Reactions is increased by its Unblockable value against this Technique.
Versatile Weapons are built for balanced combat, and can be used for both Quick and Strong Techniques, albeit not as well as Light or Heavy Weapons.
The Cost of Punish Reactions is increased by its Warding value against this Technique.
This Technique must be utilized with a Weapon, and inherits all Keywords of said Weapon.
The Cost of Block Reactions is reduced by 1 against this Technique.
